On issues from democratic independence, to same-sex marriage, to universal health care, America has looked to Massachusetts to be a national leader. America should, once again, look to us to lead the way on gun safety regulations.

My bill ‚Äî the Making America Safe and Secure Act, or MASS Act ‚Äî will authorize the Department of Justice to make grants totaling $20 million in each of the next five fiscal years to states that implement and maintain comprehensive licensing standards for gun owners and dealers.

Former Supreme Court Justice Louis Brandeis once said that each of the fifty states has the power to be a laboratory for developing new programs and policies. Right now, Massachusetts serves in that role for the other forty-nine states when it comes to gun safety legislation.
